conditionTypes.last_shot_rating: Rating of most recent shot (dialed_in | good | bad)
conditionTypes.consecutive_bad_shots: Number of consecutive poorly rated shots
conditionTypes.first_dialed_in: True if user just achieved first dialed_in rating
conditionTypes.unique_beans_used: Number of different beans with shots logged
conditionTypes.grind_settings_used: Number of different grind settings used
conditionTypes.just_unlocked_achievement: ID of achievement just unlocked (or null)
conditionTypes.retroactive_unlock_count: Number of achievements retroactively unlocked on app launch

messages: A journey of a thousand shots begins with a single bag.
Time to add your first roast.
Before we dial in, we stock up.
Loading beans is the first ritual.
The clock is ticking on freshness.
Your skills are about to be tested.
Every expert was once a beginner with a bottomless portafilter.
Entry number one in the log.
This is where the data starts.
The machine doesn't know it's your first.
Every long journey begins with terrible extraction.
The beans don't know you're new.
The first ten are the hardest.
The grinder knows your name now.
The first of many round numbers.
You've probably wasted less coffee than most people ever dial in.
The grinder answers to you now.
Your sink shot ratio is improving.
You've earned your opinions about grinders.
Your palate is not the problem anymore.
You know bad from good from great.
The variance in your shots is intentional now.
You've earned your WDT tool opinions.
At this point, you're basically doing R&D.
Your grinder should have a name by now.
The machine is an extension of you.
The sink shot ratio is approaching zero.
The learning curve is behind you.
The endgame is just more espresso.
This is what dedication looks like.
Dialed in for the first time.
This is what you came for.
This is what they talk about.
A month of not pulling shots.
A month away from the puck.
The grinder settings are stale now.
Week or more since last shot.
The muscle memory is still there.
The grind should still be close.
You're not chasing the god shot.
The streak is the point now.
The streak is its own reward.
This is how experts are made.
The hardest part is behind you.
The grinder is getting used to you.
Repeat it or ride the high.
You know what success tastes like.
The last shot set the bar.
The odds are in your favor.
Or finer. Chaos is a ladder.
The struggle is part of it.
The beans are not the enemy.
The fourth could break the streak.
The sink is earning its keep.
Consistency in failure is still consistency.
The grinder doesn't care about your feelings.
The most important shot of the week.
Let the espresso do the talking.
Start the week with a clean puck and low expectations.
The week depends on this shot.
Morning one of the work week.
Tomorrow is not a work day.
Saturday coffee is a ritual, not a task.
The ritual gets the time it needs.
The grinder has your full attention.
This is why you bought the setup.
The machine takes longer to warm.
Winter mornings were made for espresso.
The beans don't know it's freezing outside.
Winter light hits the crema different.
The chill makes the warmth sweeter.
The espresso machine is the warmest thing in the house.
The grinder doesn't care about wind chill.
The darkest mornings make the best coffee.
Summer afternoons were made for slow shots.
The beans feel the humidity too.
The long days demand more fuel.
Hot espresso on a hot day.
The afternoon slump hits harder in summer.
Warm beans, warm hands, warm cup.
The longest days need the strongest shots.
Seven days straight and locked in.
A week of dedication rewarded with perfection.
Showing up daily and nailing it.
The daily practice is paying off.
Week-long streak with a dial-in finish.
One dialed shot to prove it.
The machine doesn't know you're experienced.
Century club member having a moment.
Veteran status doesn't mean perfect shots.
Bad shots happen to good people.
The beans don't care about your shot count.
Still no immunity to bad streaks.
You've wasted maybe 2kg of beans learning. Worth it.
This is who you are now.
The beans don't know what time it is.
Somewhere a barista is just getting off shift.
The only good reason to be awake right now.
When the world is dark, make bright espresso.
Sleep is a variable you've chosen to eliminate.
When caffeine calls at 3am, you answer.
The portafilter doesn't have a bedtime.
Night owls make the best shots.
Morning light, fresh beans, good odds.
The rest of the day is just maintenance.
Morning rituals separate us from animals.
Mornings were invented for dialing in.
The first shot sets the tone.
Now make it a great extraction.
Morning light hits the crema different.
Yesterday's grind settings are just a suggestion.
The morning belongs to those who grind.
Post-lunch espresso is a lifestyle choice.
The 2pm shot separates hobbyists from addicts.
Too late to quit caffeine today.
The midday reminder that you're still here.
When willpower fades, espresso steps in.
Sleep is a social construct anyway.
Bold move pulling shots after sunset.
The responsible choice was herbal tea.
Who needs sleep when you have crema?
Because you're an adult and nobody can stop you.
When the sun sets, the shots rise.
The puck doesn't know what day it is.
One day closer to the weekend.
The rules are more suggestions now.
The grinder is ready to party.
Treat the extraction like a celebration.
Last day of the work week.
The espresso has your full attention.
The machine has you to itself.
The puck gets the attention it deserves.
The machine thanks you for the focus.
Short days call for short shots.
The beans don't mind the cold.
When the machine is the warmest spot.
When every shot is a warm hug.
When the machine adds more heat.
When commitment is measured in sweat.
The perfect shot is a hypothesis.
Somewhere, a WDT tool is waiting.
Extraction is just conversation with beans.
The portafilter doesn't care about your intentions.
The sink shot is not failure.
The grind is the first truth.
